website_summaries.verdict: A breathable and cool jacket for warm-weather rides.
pros: FreeAir poly-mesh shell reinforced with RockTex material for lightweight protection
cons: Some customers had a hard time finding the right size

customer_reviews.title: Will be ordering a replacement.... Awesome jacket
customer_reviews.text: Product worked as designed imo... Went down around 40 mph and slid. 1/2 dollar size road rash on my forearm otherwise jacket worked perfectly. Will be ordering a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: biff

customer_reviews.title: Fits good, snug but not too snug
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for summer here in Tennessee. I am 6'1" about 215 (athletic build) and bought the XL tall. Fits good, snug but not too snug. Armor sits in the right places. Wearing this jacket is like wearing just a T-shirt, air flow is great. Also like the fact that it comes with a rain liner. The zippers can be a little finicky, if I zip too fast they get caught in the mesh, but not enough for me to knock off a star. Looks good also. Joe Rocket is proud of their name. If I could change one thing, it would be removing the big "Rocket" across the bottom of the back.
customer_reviews.author: cowboybarber

customer_reviews.title: Returned It
customer_reviews.text: It gets really good reviews, and looked good from a distance. However, up close in person everything about the jacket screamed $66 instead of $166. Zippers are cheap, no internal pocket for sunglasses, side pockets too small for riding gloves, CE elbow pads seem like toys and pocket too low leaving elbow partially protected, and the windbreaker/water resistant liner seemed like the quality of a promotional give away. Also, the zipper and velcro on cuffs didn't work well together, and the waist adjustment wasn't well designed either.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B

customer_reviews.title: I love the summer jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews from people who actually went down while wearing it. I never have, and hope to keep it that way. So, I can only review the comfort and looks. It's great: the fit is exactly what I would have expected, it's much lighter than a normal leather jacket, and I stay cool in summer. The liner really does block wind nicely for cooler days. I love this jacket, and hope to never test it's protective capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed for some riders, but not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to like this jacket, but after wearing it for a month, I really know now I made a huge mistake in buying it. It is unbearably HEAVY! The material is so shiny that it is glitzy which I hate. It fits poorly with or without the padding. Back pad is impossible for me to wear. In hot weather, it was OK, but when temps dropped below 70F degrees, it was far too cold for riding, even with the liner. In fact, the liner made me sweat, even though I was actually chilly. I prefer my old leather jacket, and even my denim jacket to this. Oh well, too late to return it. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Stancil Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Really love this jacket
customer_reviews.text: Air goes through to keep you cool in the summer, but the heavy duty pads in the elbows and shoulders give me confidence that they will protect me in a fall. I hope I never have to test it out. I like how it connects up with the matching pants to give almost a full suit protection. Looks great and much more comfortable than leather when it's hot. Also comes with a zip-out liner you can use in the fall to make it warmer. My buddy liked it so much he bought his own.
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: I’m a big dude, and this is a big jacket.
customer_reviews.text: If the hulk had his way with shrek... I would be their albino lovechild... this jacket fits me perfect... belly and all... standing at 6’2” and the shoulders of a retired lumberjack... I look jacked in this jacket. Fat... but totally jacked in the shoulders! This is a great jacket for big guys who have limited gear options. Ride save and do yourself a favor and get one of these... they look cool, breath well, have a rain insert that’s easy to put in and remove. And accepts higher grade armor if you want to replace the foam/plastic inserts. Jacket is of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer-of-Things

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipper and exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast shipper and the jacket is exactly what I wanted. I am 5’11 & 235 and went with XXL. Though the XL was me by the sizing chart, I usually wear long sleeved work shirts so figured the extra X was needed. That was the right decision. I chose white/black to match the color of my Goldwing and helmet. I purchased a Joe Rocket 12 years ago and it lasted this long but wear, tear, and washing got the best of it. I think I got good mileage out of the old one and can only assume I will get the same from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Shipp

customer_reviews.title: Great hot weather jacket
customer_reviews.text: Just moved from Germany to South Florida and I wasn't about to give up riding because of the heat. I always wear protection riding, so to balance the need for protection with the dislike of heat, I sprung for this jacket. It's surprisingly cool and the padding stays perfectly in place. I feel safe riding in this gear, and I keep cool as long as it's not over 95f. Great product I would recommend to anyone wanting to ride in hot climates.
customer_reviews.author: Jake and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Love, But A Little Rough Though On The Inside, Pockets Get Wet In Rain.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first riding jacket. I love it though. I am tall and it still fits me well. Vents extremely well. Tightens at elbows to better keep pads on. Rain gear works well. My only issues with it are two-fold. One, without the insert, the fabric is a little rough inside, but a long sleeved shirt helps with that. Two, the main pockets are outside of the rain gear, so if you get soaked, what's in your pocket does too, i.e. insurance papers. On a positive note, the rain gear cuts down on wind and makes it very comfortable on cooler days where just removing the wind chill keeps you warmer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Nice for mesh
customer_reviews.text: Ok so Missouri gets hot, I wanted some protection on those days. Airflow is good as long as your moving. Armor is so so, I will be upgrading that. As long as im moving I can wear this in 90+ degree weather and be comfortable and feel somewhat secure. Its not full blown leather protection but its great to throw over a tshirt on those days. Im 5'10" and 200lbs a large fit me well. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Cool & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Jacket arrived on time and well packaged. I took it out and tried it on (it's a medium and I am 5'10" 165#) and the fit was perfect. I took out the liner to go for a ride since the temp was 85 degrees. That jacket is sooo cool, not just cool looking but it allows plenty of air flow because of the mesh. The white parts makes me much more visible to drivers as well and matches my white helmet. The armor is in all the right places and is comfortable, even without the liner. I would strongly recommend this jacket for warm/hot weather riding.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd Joe Rocket jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I have one for my street bike, a heavier one for the winter for my dual-sport, and now this one for the summer on either. With the liners out, it's super-comfortable in the warm weather, and the armor is reassuring. And it may be a small thing, but on this one, the pockets actually zip the correct direction - that is, they zip down to close, so they won't open unnoticed. My other two have zip-up pockets, and I'm always checking to make sure they've stayed closed (which they always have, it's just my OCD). Awesome jacket, and a great price - won't be my last Joe Rocket gear.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wright

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite summer jackets
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is one of my favorite mesh jackets I've owned to date. So much that this is the my 2nd purchase of this jacket model over 8 or 9yrs. The jacket is built/constructed to last. My current black and gray one has started to fade and looks very dull. The liner is a great one as well. Makes for a good but odd looking light jacket also.
customer_reviews.author: X.Ram

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Excellent for warm/hot weather
customer_reviews.text: I like it. California daily commuter. 90F+ in the afternoon. Good airflow but seems quote sturdy and provides protection. Functional pockets and good quality zippers. Could not be happier. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rügemer

customer_reviews.title: Great venting. The rain-proof liner has been used multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a summer-weight jacket for hot, Colorado days. Great venting. The rain-proof liner has been used multiple times on weekend rides and keeps me dry. Liner goes in/out easily. Prefer my leather jacket, but this is a suitable alternative when its 90 degrees+ out. I like the elbow cinch-strap which keeps the sleeves and the padding in the right spot. I've recommended to friends and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best armored Motorcycle warm weather jacket
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt, the best armored Motorcycle warm weather jacket I have ever owned.. fits as expected.. Highly recommended over a t-shirt ride.. keep safe and cool.. it actually cools you better than a t-short only run.. plus you don't have that sun burning your arms thru the day.. nor that fall rash if you do hit the pavement(lets hope not) The included liner will come in handy when the weather turns to a chill.. quit thinking about it.. just buy it..
customer_reviews.author: MichaelD

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light with good air flow
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Joe Rocket Phoenix and I wish I could give it five stars but the lack of a good inside pocket kills that. Yes, there is an inside pocket but it is for glasses and doesn't close securely enough for my extra keys and insurance paper for the bikes. But it is the lightest of the three and flows more air than either of the others. I also like the dayglow chest panel (same on the back) as I love being seen on the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Locke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Summer Riding Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I've taken a spill in this going too far into a corner than I should have, and it did it's job splendidly. It also actually makes riding in summer pretty comfortable, since it keeps the sun off your skin and circulates air underwear the mesh. But it still has what you need when things go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Well made product.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dual sport so my rideing position is pretty high. You can really feel the wind move through the jacket . Even around the padding . The pockets on the front will hold my smart phone w/otterbox . The pocket inside the jacket is a bit difficult to use for sunglasses but it would be nice storage for something else. If you can make sure you get your chest mesurement and arm length close when ordering your size. The waist and forarms have velcro and button clips for adjustments so there is some play there.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: All gear - all the time!
customer_reviews.text: After about 8 years of riding, I crashed a streetbike for the first time. In a corner around 70mph. I was wearing a Joe Rocket jacket and connected Bilt armored pants. Although I slid for more than a few feet of pavement, road rash was very minor. I still have that jacket. I bought this new one because I have another bike now and I wanted a different color jacket. This new jacket that I ordered from Amazon is of almost identical construction to one I bought in a store 8 years ago. These are great jackets that preform their intended function beautifully. Wear all gear - all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Pair with the pants for best results. Stays super cool on the hottest of ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need, nothing you don't. Pair with the pants for best results. Stays super cool on the hottest of days; waterproof liner is pretty meh so I just layer up under it. Armor is well-placed and doesn't move around as long as .... well, as long as you're my shape/size. A pudgy 210 at 6'. Zippers are my only complaint, but at this price point expecting more would be unrealistic.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket. Fits true to size. Although the protector pads are in the jacket, still feels lightweight. Doesn't feel bulky. With the rain liner removed, air flow is great. Haven't used it in the rain yet. Only dislike like others have mentioned is the lack of a larger inside pocket to protect my phone when it does rain.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Makes riding in the heat bearable!
customer_reviews.text: Great mesh high visibility jacket. Easy to adjust for a great fit, mesh keeps me cool when it’s 100° out, and makes riding in 110°+ Las Vegas summers bearable. Bright yellow makes sure wayward cagers see me too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Cowles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome summer jacket! 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Man if you’re looking at this jacket for summer riding just buy it it you’ll thank me later. It has very good airflow for those hot days and it doesn’t break the bank. The armor is decent on the elbows, the back protector doesn’t look nor feel safe lol but eh just replace it with a better one. Obviously it’s mesh so sliding protection won’t be that great but it’s better than being a squid with just a t shirt on.
customer_reviews.author: Joel p

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I am large framed, 5 '9" and 240 lbs. wide shouldered. I ordered an XXL and it fits perfectly. Good material and nicely made. Took it for a ride today. It was 91 degrees and air flowed thru nicely (with the liner removed of course). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: NorthFish

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Been riding for years and recently went down in cool weather with leather jacket on and no road rash. Decided to go for similar protection in summer and found this jacket. It let plenty of air in on the first mid eighty degree day this spring in Georgia and the quality seems great. Its true what people say about sizing seeming a little tight but local motorsports store sales person said it clearly "this is a go down jacket" and I wanted he was right. Jacket stays in place and has good amount of adjustment in waist and arms.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Summer riding!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket! I bought it for riding in hot weather and the mesh lets do much air through it is delightful while still affording some protection. The rain liner worked great too the one day I wore it in the rain. The back armor seemed very flimsy though so I bought an upgrade for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Z.

customer_reviews.title: fits great. Liner out is a little loose but I ...
customer_reviews.text: size Med Tall. Had to buy a jacket to replace one I had lost too much weight to wear safely. I had an operation that has left me at 145#. The problem is I'm 6'2" and was swimming in my old gear(was 180#), and this one, with the liner in, fits great. Liner out is a little loose but I don't think clothes are made with people at my current size in mind. Looks like it will fit even if I pick up 10 or 15 lbs because of waist and sleeve adjusters. Back pads a little cheap but workable.
customer_reviews.author: TaS

customer_reviews.title: Cool summer jacket
customer_reviews.text: Bought this jacket for New England summers. Air moves freely through the jacket, feels like wearing a long-sleeve t-shirt. Armor is ok, not the best but suitable. Gray color is darker than expected, very nice and a little more visible than black. Tall sizing is spot on (6'4"), so nice to have sleeves reach my wrists in a riding position.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great hot weather jacket. I live in south Florida and this jacket is great. Very breathable and very good quality. Couldn't be happier. Only gave 1 star on water resistant because I removed the removable rain liner inside for good air flow. Too hot with it in. If you know your going to be riding in the rain before you leave you could install it but you might as well just use a rain suit at that point.
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket. It is very comfortable. Not to hot and has very good protection. The sizing is true to what is listed on the tag.
customer_reviews.author: John Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jacket
customer_reviews.text: It's hot in the South so I bought this for my husband. He did did some research and this was his favorite. We were happy we could buy it thru Amazon! He loves this jacket, it fits him well and it keeps him from melting in this heat.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great armor
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5' 11" about 200 lbs and the medium fits perfectly. It is comfortable too. It's still fairly cold here so I've only rode in it twice. It should be great once it heats up here. It looks like it will provide great protection if I go down.
customer_reviews.author: wantdd214

customer_reviews.text: I bought the large tall and medium tall and the medium tall fit better, it's snug and the sleeves are plenty long. The large tall was a little baggy and the armour didn't really stay where I wanted it to. I sent the large back and easily got a refund. I suggest if your not sure what size to get buy two and send the other one back, I got the exact size I needed for roughly 9 dollars off the refund of the jacket. The sizing is different with every brand because most of my other jackets are large. But the jacket looks clean, it breathes great and sometimes to well after dark.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Brasuell

customer_reviews.title: Front Zipper Issue
customer_reviews.text: I liked the features (air flow, styling, pockets...) and sizing. Unfortunately, the front zipper starts peeling away from the bottom. There are waist adjustment velcro tabs - they weren't tightened. It wasn't a problem to get the zipper closed - just a pain and this shouldn't be happening while seated.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Super cool in hot weather
customer_reviews.text: Super cool in hot weather, but warm with the liner. This jacket is very comfortable, while the extensive armor makes me feel safe.Normally, motorcycle jackets don't fit me well, as they seemed designed for skinny teenagers. This one is comfortable for a portly old man who likes to ride a sport bike. :-) In a pinch, it makes a great pillow to sleep on the floor with. The only downside is the room it requires, the jacket does not pack down well into a saddlebag.. All that armor makes it bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jacket
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5ft 10in, 200lbs, 48in chest, 35in waist and the XL fits me perfect. High quality material. Nothing feels cheap like the other cheaper brands out there. Comes with a rain liner that fits snug inside without bunching up. I live on the Gulf Coast where it is hot most of the year and this jacket is the coolest jacket I have as far as keeping my body temp down. I'd buy another one of these in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight K. Schrute

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Naked
customer_reviews.text: This is about as close to naked as you should be on a motorcycle. The mesh performs quite nicely allowing the air to blow through and keep you cool, while still brandishing the needed padding. This jacket is loaded with features: key holders, extra pockets, lots of adjustments and removeable padding. It also comes with a waterproof liner. Once you zip the liner in, I imagine it will keep me dry. It is summer in Texas so I doubt I will see rain anytime soon to test it.
customer_reviews.author: Namloaktox

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: This product literally saved my life. Bought this jacket 3 days before a long journey. On the way home from the journey (rain, lightning, traffic) a car swerved into my lane forcing me to apply the brakes and causing my bike to swerve and my body taking a severe pounding on the pavement (6/24/18). Though I broke my collar bone and 4 ribs, it could've been worse. Unfortunately, the paramedics spliced the jacket into pieces. The protective gear did it's job and I'm so thankful.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable even on the hottest of days. The mesh allows air to flow through and keep you cooled off while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Jen D.

customer_reviews.title: Breathable is key...
customer_reviews.text: I use this jacket for my daily commute in Arizona heat, and love how breathable it is. You do feel the heat when still in traffic, let's be reasonable in 104 degree weather... But when you move you can feel the air circulating while feeling protected. Definitely a good buy and highly recommend if you ride in hot weather, you do need to remove the liner. (Another great feature).
customer_reviews.author: JJRamos

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this jacket
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this jacket. Was looking for a mesh jacket for summer riding because I live Arizona and my other jacket it just too hot to wear. I bought this one because it had so many reviews specifically from people in Arizona and Texas. It has met all my expectations. I did return the first one they sent me because the left sleeve was slightly larger than the right even with the strap pulled down evenly on both sides. Not a huge deal but it drove me nuts. Had no issues returning it and ordered a second one. This one fits like it should. No complaints. It's even comfortable to wear when it's 105. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous riding jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Paired this jacket with a pair of Joe Rocket Phoenix 3.0 pants. Great combination riding gear. I am 5'10", 198 lbs with long arms. I wear this jacket over my normal riding clothes. The protection pads line up where they as supposed to be for me. Adjustable elbow pad straps. If you are thinking about purchasing good quality, well designed and properly proportioned riding gear, stop thinking and buy this jacket and the pants. Adding protection will not decrease your riding enjoyment at all. My current bikes are a BMW R1150 RT and a Victory Vegas. I look awesome on either bike with this gear on.
customer_reviews.author: DrSparx

customer_reviews.title: Great summer jacket
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid summer jacket. It has an inner rain coat that's removable which is a nice touch. I wore on my trip from Kentucky to Florida during the summer. It still gets hot, but the mesh is WAYYYY better than leather would be at keeping you cool. It allows a fair amount of wind to come through. The high viz is nice. Cons: The zipper handles get turned to the side on the pockets and it's a pain to get them turned back.
customer_reviews.author: C. Edge

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Yes. I had this jacket for about eight years the first time. No issues. Finally started to rip along the seams. So, why not pay $165 to get another eight years?? Perfect
customer_reviews.author: L. Clopton

customer_reviews.title: Great Moto Jacket for Hot Weather Riding
customer_reviews.text: These jackets are great for hot weather riding. I own two of them. They tend to run a little small - so you might want to go up a size when you order. I am 6 ft 225 lbs and went with the 'XL Tall' version of the jacket. The first one that came was just the XL version and it was a little tight.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Ultra Classic

customer_reviews.title: Odd fit in shoulders.
customer_reviews.text: The padding on the shoulders on joe rocket jackets for some reason constantly roll to the back of my shoulder blades leaving my anterior shoulder exposed. Going up or down in sizes doesn’t help.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper7

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and cool for riding in the hot summer!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of this motorcycle safety jacket. Took out the lining for summer riding, and the mesh let's enough air thought to make a HOT day comfortable for riding the motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Royce L. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very good jacket, feels like it would save you a great deal during a slide. It does get quite hot in it on hot days, which deters you from wearing it... anyways, highly recommend for sport bike riders like me!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Well made, versatile jacket. Warm in 40 deg temps and cools off excellently in the heat. Adjustable fit and liner removal is very well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: DClos

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and generally reflective without being ludicrous looking.
customer_reviews.text: Good all 'rounder. The straps help to keep padding secure all over your body, and the mesh keeps you cool. The zip can snag just a little, what with it being mesh, so I find I'm being careful there, but otherwise, everything is great. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Breaddrink

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and cool
customer_reviews.text: I like the jacket. I’m 5’8 165 athletic and the medium fit perfect. Nice and cool while riding without the waterproof insert. I’m in SFL so it’s HOT down here and this thing keeps me cool and not weighted down. This however is my first jacket so take that review with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Joe rocket has come a long way.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Joe rocket jacket I have bought in 15 years. They have come a long way! I can't imagine a better jacket for warm weather riding.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen G Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hoy weather and perfect Fit.
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is really comfortable. The air flow thru it is awesome perfect for hot weather. I live on the Caribbean area and use it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of good features in this jacket. It can be worn in wet or cool weather with the included removable lining, or without it in warm to hot weather. Either way you have the protective shoulder, elbow, and neck pads and the very desirable high visibility neon. There are size adjustments at the arms, wrists, and waist. There are two zippered outer front slash pockets, a left inner eyeglass pocket with velcro closure, and a right upper inner swivel snap for keys. Quality of design, materials, and manufacture appears excellent.
customer_reviews.author: wfwkwa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome jacket so far. Padding seems perfect. Quality made product for sure. I’m 6-2 245 lbs. ordered the 2xl and it fits great. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ed

customer_reviews.title: Tall guys BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Fits GREAT! Most motorcycle jackets are built for small guys but this thing is cut very roomy. And the tall size is great, no more flashing crack to the people behind you. It does let a lot of air through when you're moving but if you expect to stay cool in a traffic jam...nope. You still sweat like a pig, but at least once you get moving you will dry out faster. The removable waterproof lining means this jacket will be good for 3 seasons, and possibly even most of the 4th down south.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: First biker jacket
customer_reviews.text: Everyone recommends Joe Rocket and now I know why. This jacket is adjustable in many ways for maximum comfort plus it provides protection in case of an incident. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for warm weather but liner could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Great for warm weather, but liner isn't breathable. Would be 5 stars if liner was made from breathable material. Also, inner pocket should be bigger to accommodate larger size phones. I couldn't imagine riding in warm weather with anything else, mesh design without liner allows for excellent air movement.
customer_reviews.author: A. Karsten

customer_reviews.title: Waist tight and high.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than expected. The arms and shoulders are comfortable but the waist is tight. The waist is quite high as well. It was very hot when I wore it. I was riding around 50 mph but there was some sweat inside. I had taken the waterproof lining out. Since that is on the inside one is almost expected to decide if there will be rain before togging up. Once it is raining To have to take the jacket off to install the lining seems the wrong way around.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great riding jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Fit good using chart, really is comfortable, and so cool when rides, catches the wind and circulates it nicely! Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's great to have some colors you can change around sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket. I am 6-3 235lbs and ordered the tall for a perfect fit. I really like the looks of this jacket it's just nice to mix things up once in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: redrock435

customer_reviews.title: 0 jacket for 10 years and am completely satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: I have a Phoenix 4.0 jacket for 10 years and am completely satisfied with it. I bought this jacket to match the new bike . The 5.0 is considerably lighter than the 4.0 is. This is good in some ways but I'm wondering how it will hold up? The only thing I don't like so far is the zipper for the pants is not compatible between 5.0 and 4.0. I guess Joe Rocket want's you to buy new pants too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: Went down wearing this jack on June 18th. I was ran off the road by a driver who was not paying attention. I suffers some serious injuries, but this jacket protected me from broken elbows, shoulders, and arms. The pads worked perfectly. Had very minimal road rash and the jacket could probably still be work if the pads were replaced. Can't ask for more!!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Roe

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected and makes my summer ride so much ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected and makes my summer ride so much more enjoyable! The zip out liner will come in handy as fall approaches and being waterproof will help when I get caught in the unexpexted rain shower.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gillman

customer_reviews.title: great jacket.
customer_reviews.text: The jacket gives lots of ventilation. Summer is not so bad anymore. The liner is very good at keeping me dry when it rains. It is also enough to keep warm in the mornings. The fit a little small for an XL. The real problem is the jacket is tight over my riding pants and middle aged belly. Overall, I like the jacket, fits good and is cool. The liner is great in the mornings and if it rains. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Terrible stitching.  :(
customer_reviews.text: After trying it on two or three times for fit (which seemed about right) the seams on the adjustable side straps began to come out. I won't trust my well-being to something that's got shoddy stitching right out of the box. Deeply disappointed. (returned it for refund and bought something else in person)
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket Despite Loose Elbow Pads.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit! I'm 5' 6" 175 lbs with a bit of a beer gut. The medium was the right choice for me. I would have given 5 stars but like others have stated already there is way too much room in the sleeves such that the elbow pads can move to the side of your arm even with the adjustment straps cinched all the way. Other than that it's a very nice jacket for summer riding and with the waterproof liner inserted it should be adequate for cooler weather as well. All in all I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Love the look
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love the look, the fit, the added feel of extra protection! Recommend if iffy on the size, order a size smaller. Does seem to run a bit big. (Around the chest.) 6ft, 180lbs, ordered a medium, and could probably get away with a.... small. If have a Joe Rocket dealer in your town, recommend trying them on first, but overall, very happy with mine!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Saved me
customer_reviews.text: Went down doing about 45-50 mph. Had some bumps and bruises and just a little road rash on my elbow that I guess I got inside the jacket. No doubt this jacket saved me alot of pain and doesn't even have a scratch on it. I woukd highly recommend this to anyone. Stays pretty cool as also
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection on Hot Days
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my ancient Phoenix 1.0. Like my 1.0, this is a great way to get good crash protection on hot days. Upgraded details make it look and work better than the 1.0. Haven’t used the lining, so I cannot comment on its function - but it is kind of plasticity and looks hot to wear.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Rath

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mesh. It’s as close to not wearing any jacket in the breathability arena. Good armor where it needs it. Just carefully cut the stitching on the Busch league logos and you have yourself a great jacket. It fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Harshman

customer_reviews.title: Greast product for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Fits me perfectly (I'm short and fat always have issues with arms when buying jackets but I can adjust the arms armor on this one so it works) also very cool living in Florida that is something we value a lot here lol.
customer_reviews.author: Desorden

customer_reviews.title: They make big guy jackets! Heck yeah!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this jacket, since it fits me. I am a big guy with door width shoulders. I bought the size 4, which is a bit big, even with my spare tire. I will lose this spare tire, and get a size 3 next time haha.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Parker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Joe Rocket jacket that I have purchased. This one was for my son when he goes out riding with me. Reasonably priced and very well made. You can't beat them.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: I needed a 3 season motorcycle jacket with a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 3 season motorcycle jacket with a lot of air flow for the summer in California. This jacket provides protection, but, allows a lot of air flow. Plus it has an removable liner which provides warmth in cooler weather.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Overton

customer_reviews.title: I am 6’4’’ fit is good. I got a 2x sleeves were great and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 6’4’’ fit is good. I got a 2x sleeves were great and fit well in the shoulders.l but the jacket length is just a bit short for me. The tall sizing would have had too much sleeve length. Overall very nice jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Abel

customer_reviews.title: Does what Joe Rocket says
customer_reviews.text: For me it’s a perfect 3 season jacket. It’s breezy enough without the rain liner that 90+ let’s you ride in comfort, even on a Goldwing.
customer_reviews.author: RANDALL A MACMILLAN

customer_reviews.title: Summer comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and superb summer comfort. Have not gone through rain yet, so cannot speak to water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: brian s.

customer_reviews.title: I love it -- almost
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is VERY visible, which is why I bought it. It's kind of a pain installing the inner liner, then removing it, then installing it, each time the weather turns. The jacket (without liner) is comfortable into the upper 80s -- so long as you're moving! At a stop, you cook. With the liner installed, it's a good fall jacket. Could use a few more pockets. The armor is light weight, but it should prevent the worst road rash in critical areas -- after which you'll need a new jacket.
customer_reviews.author: EKH

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: excellent Jacket. Very light when wearing. Great adjustments available and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort in warm weather.
customer_reviews.text: I received my jacket very quickly from Amazon. I believe in just a few days. It fit properly and was very comfortable. I was amazed at the air flow when riding in warm weather. Great protection in Florida heat.
customer_reviews.author: rayray45

customer_reviews.title: Quality jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Love my Joe Rocket motorcycle jacket. I am an XL and this jacket fits perfectly. Very well made. Liner is very easy to zip in and out. With liner in the jacket is waterproof. Take liner out and you have a very comfortable mesh jacket. Haven't had to try out the padding and hope I never have to. Really like the high vis yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Scriptpro727

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and the size is darn near perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I researched mesh jackets extensively and chose this one as the best value. The price I paid was $150 with free shipping on Amazon, which was the best price I could find anywhere trustworthy. It was $165 in the motorcycle shop. I am 5'10" and weigh 190 (no significant belly) and a medium fit me snugly with the liner in. I will mostly wear it with the lining removed. I wouldn't want a larger size. The quality seems very good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A 5x that is actually a 5x. .
customer_reviews.text: This is for all the burly men that are having problems finding a good mesh summer riding jacket. This is my third jacket that I have purchased in a month and all the others were to small and the size charts were way off. Joe Rocket jackets are true to the "size". I'm 6 foot 2 and around 375 lb and have finally found a 5x jacket that is actually a 5x and with the quality I was was looking for with out spending a fortune. Thanks Joe Rocket for taking care of the man sizes I feel alot safer on the road.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: A great jacket
customer_reviews.text: I very much like this jacket. It has great airflow for warm/hot days. The quality is very good. The liner zips in and out very easily. As a rider in a large city I definitely like the hi-viz color. Its a little pricey but still a good deal. The fit for me was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Aim9sidewinder

customer_reviews.title: Great Mesh Jacket for Hot Weather.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great jacket if you live in a hot climate. I'm 6' 1" tall and weigh about 215 and the XL fits perfectly. If you take the liner out in the summer the airflows through the jacket nicely. Great mesh jacket if thats what you're looking for especially in the Arizona heat.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Seward

customer_reviews.title: 5'9" and 150 pounds = small jacket
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 feet 9 inches tall and weigh 145 pounds. Medium build. The size Small fits me perfectly. There's a little play in the sleeves, around the elbow and forearms but the jacket comes with a snap adjustment on the inner arm that cinches it so it fits. If I had gotten a Medium, I'd be swimming in it. It's made very well. Update- It's well made. It survived two trips to the local car wash to clean off bugs and grease. Worn it for about 3,000 miles in midwestern humidity and heat. Still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kellan

customer_reviews.title: Great fully wented mc-jackets
customer_reviews.text: Great wented jackets here in tropic aera. Removeble watertight innerjacket,who is great to bring and pull over the jacket if rainey.
customer_reviews.author: Tor

customer_reviews.title: Avoid plastic zippers
customer_reviews.text: Overall okay, but one of the plastic sleeve zippers has already failed at less than 2k miles (second season) and I only ride 5 months a year. I'll look for something with metal zippers.
customer_reviews.author: circa55

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket and a perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket and a perfect fit. Lightweight with excellent airflow. The armor in the elbows and shoulders is good but the back is just a pad and you should upgrade it to something better. Not a big deal for a $150 jacket.
customer_reviews.author: R. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, works as advertised in hot summer in Texas
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' tall and 200 Lbs. Bought an XL and it fit great. Feel much safer wearing this jacket and have worn it on many 90 - 100 degree days here in Texas. Arms seem to cool the best. As others have said, came in a large box folded in half on a good hanger. Good quality and buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jacket for my son who was impressed with all the protective features this jacket had. Several people he worked with even commented how much they would like one. Then one day I got a call from my son who said the jacket worked like it was suppose to. He was calling from and ER and the shoulder and elbows cups saved him from damage to those parts of his body as he slid down the pavement after crashing on his bike. I am so glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rbird1286

customer_reviews.title: Good mesh jacket
customer_reviews.text: It's warm a lot of the year where I ride most and this jacket flows air and protects well.
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not enough pockets and airflow wasn't as good as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Not enough pockets. It worked OK in the summer heat of Arizona, but I ended up returning it and getting a TourMaster Men's Intake Air 4.0 Jacket that flowed more air and had more options and pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this jacket
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this jacket. I live in an area of Costa Rica where the day time temperature is 80-85 degrees every day. At the lower elevations it's in the 90's. I ride in both conditions and I stay cool while I am riding. I am 6' 1" and weigh 190. I ordered the size large - fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dave and Valentina

customer_reviews.title: Joe Rocket Mesh Bike Jacket
customer_reviews.text: ORANGE! Matched the bike. Fits great. Looks great. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: DanoRoadBlade

customer_reviews.title: Going up a size might have made the torso fit better but would exacerbate the arm fit
customer_reviews.text: I returned the jacket after I receiving it and checking the fit; ordered a Pilot Motosport Mesh jacket instead. The sizing was way off: I ordered a small per the sizing chart and other reviewers recommendations but the torso was much too tight and the arms were much too long and baggy. Going up a size might have made the torso fit better but would exacerbate the arm fit. There was also a flaw on one of the snaps that prevented it from being used.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J. Cleland

customer_reviews.title: I am 6' 1" This fits me perfect although its mesh so it does not have the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' 1" This fits me perfect although its mesh so it does not have the skin tight look. Its tad long on my arms but i would rather have it slightly long then short. Armor is good and the build quality is great. Enough pockets to store what you need to would recommend for low to medium rides. Still feels great going 130MPH.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

product_meta.title: Joe Rocket Phoenix 5.0 Men's Mesh Motorcycle Riding Jacket (Silver/Silver, XX-Large)
product_meta.description: Size:XX-Large| Color:Silver/SilverPhoenix, the series that redefined the mesh jacket continues to tame summer heat with the cooling airflow of our exclusive FreeAir mesh.
feature_bullets: FreeAir poly/mesh shell reinforced with RockTex at the shoulders, elbows, and ribs for added protection, C.E. approved armor at the shoulders and elbows
Removable spine pad with pocket for optional C.E. spine armor, Sculpted high density padding at ribs, kidneys and lower back
Zipper secured removable waterproof liner, 6-point SureFit custom adjustment system, 8 zipper for pant attachment, Snap loops for pant attachment
2 outside hand warmer pockets, Internal breast pocket, Extended back
Pocket for eyeglasses storage, Reflective stripe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars552 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
